When I am referring to David's natural voice, I only them on  the RS it's 
=
the only spirit radio I own, when I talk to Him in Skype,  he sounds very 
=
mechanical, and I am still learning that language which is  very difficult =
to 
understand by most people, myself included.  Here is a  sample of that,=
 and I 
have a few of His real voice taken from my RS.   He seems to be one=
 of the 
Tech's, and is "very busy" over there, He  also helps with the pro=
cessing of 
spirits coming into the Light for the first  time from plains o=
f darkness, 
and seems to on the welcoming committee over  there, He told m=
e that He 
works from about 7 am to 12 midnight every  day that's est.and d=
oesn't really 
have time to be always doing these things for  you RJ. sf 
 =

 
In a message dated 7/14/2010 7:35:02 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
raste=
rer@... writes:

 
 
 
I received no prediction on the object from yo=
u Frank, or  from your 
methods or technologies.  We look forward to your  =
participation in the next 
experiment though. 

--- On Wed,  7/14/10, Frank=
 Sumption  <purplealiengirl@purpleali> wrote:


From:  Frank Sumption <purp=
lealiengirl@purpleali>
Subject: Re:  [EVP-ITC] Experiment 20100710 - RESULT=
S!
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Date: Wednesday, July 14, 2010, 4:29  PM


=
 
So you're not going to count my prediction as accurate? Or at  least a bi=
g 
DAH!
 
 So go out in the world and claim you thoroughly debunked  spirit=
's 
existence.
 
 
 
 F-S


On Wed, Jul 14, 2010 at 12:00 PM, rasterer  <_r=
asterer@yahoo.  com_ 
(mip://0c92dd48/mc/compose?to=3Drasterer@...) >=
 wrote:


 
 
 

Thanks again for everyone who participated! I admire your =
 courage and 
motivation to try different methods, see what works, and  try=
 to improve 
everyone's understanding of EVP-ITC.

If you  recall, on 7/10/=
2010 I placed an object on top of my computer  
monitor, right in front of =
me, and left it there until today,  7/14/2010, noon 
Denver time. The exper=
iment was for participants to  determine what it was. 
Vague or partial ans=
wers wouldn't be counted  (for example, just colors, 
shapes, sizes, what i=
t's made of, etc):  we're looking for what it is. 
Participants could use t=
heir ghost  boxes, EVP recorders, or I suppose any other 
means they  chose=
.

In order to keep me honest, I took a picture of the  object at the start=
 of 
the experiment and loaded it to the Files  section (RJ folder) of this=
 
group. If you can follow the link, it is  here:

_http://tech. groups.yah=
oo. com/group/  EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
1.zip_ (http://tech.groups.=
yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.zip) 

The idea was that  yo=
u could download the file at the beginning of the 
test, and 'keep  it safe=
' on your computer. Then at the end of the test, I would 
 release the pass=
word so you could reveal the contents of the file.  That 
way, you were in =
control of the original image during the  entire test, not 
me. 

The passw=
ord for that file is:  123BlastOff
Instructions, if you need them, are also=
 in that RJ  folder.

And if you did not care to download the zip file  bef=
ore the test, I will 
post the final image there too.

So to  the results:
=

Number of participants: 5
Total tries:  8
Ambiguous answers: 0
Correct ans=
wers: 0

Object: A  radio
Uzipped picture:
_http://tech. groups.yahoo. com/=
group/  EVP-ITC/files/ RJ/RJ.20100710. 
1.JPG_ (http://tech.groups.yahoo.co=
m/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.JPG) 

So what do the  results mean?=
 All that we can really agree on from this 
experiment  is that no particip=
ant, with whatever theories or methods or  
technology they used, was able =
to correctly determine the object. We  can't say 
those theories or methods=
 or technologies never work. Just  as we can't say 
they do. Just that, for=
 whatever reason, they did  not work this time. 
Readers can take the resul=
ts, use them to  improve or change their methods, or 
keep doing what they'=
re  doing.

If anyone has any observations, comments, or ideas for  improve=
ment, let me 
know. I hope to get a new experiment up and  running soon. Si=
nce there 
wasn't much participation Mon-Wed, I think  the next experiment =
will be arranged 
to mostly span the  weekends.

Again, thanks to everyone =
who participated in this  first experiment.
















--part1_8018b.1895d18.396fba56_alt_boundary
